title: Hasbro Earnings, Revenue Miss in Q3
text:
Investing.com - Hasbro reported third quarter earnings that missed analysts' expectations on Tuesday and revenue that fell short of forecasts.

The firm reported earnings per share of $1.84 on revenue of $1.58B. Analysts polled by Investing.com expected EPS of $2.21 on revenue of $1.72B. That compared to EPS of $1.93 on revenue of $1.57B in the same period a year earlier. The company had reported EPS of $0.78 on revenue of $984.54M in the previous quarter.





Hasbro follows other major Consumer Cyclical sector earnings this month

On September 24, Nike reported first quarter EPS of $0.86 on revenue of $10.66B, compared to forecasts of EPS of $0.7 on revenue of $10.44B.

AutoZone earnings beat analysts' expectations on September 24, with fourth quarter EPS of $22.59 on revenue of $3.75B. Investing.com analysts expected EPS of $21.77 on revenue of $3.93B

Stay up-to-date on all of the upcoming earnings reports by visiting Investing.com's earnings calendar
